author: @thryce82
text: this is a stupid title.  stock price does not "take down a company"  it is literally what a company sold for ownership.  if it goes down too low then a company can buy it back decreasing the supply and then increasing its price.  The financial health of a compnay and its stock price are not nearly as correlated as this title implies.   It will get clicks and views from people who dont know any better.  It also makes me lose faith in the content this channel puts out.  If you arent riding some click bait then you dont understand basic business 101.

author: @tensorlab
text: What most people and Ed tech companies don‚Äôt understand or choose to ignore is, technology in itself isn‚Äôt desirable unless you have understanding of monetising it in terms of business context. A person might be expert in coding but if he cannot translate that skills to a meaningful solution in real world, he gets replaced. If technology by itself was path to money we wouldn‚Äôt have had enormous number of millionaires from non tech background. Unfortunately education in India fails to address this issue and is purely based on who can solve difficult problems and obtain highest mark‚Äôs possible.

text: The dangers of this technology is that it will affect every company in all the fields if this companies starts using it heavily, because as an AI will start learning the domains and the intricacies of the business that many companies have developed and worked in a long time, and what would stop the owner of the AI to just start doing the same business using his AI, and opening all kinds of businesses in all fields to make more money, since this companies are giving away their know how for free by using this AI and training it, not to mention that the need for workers would decrees exponentially, so if anything if you have an expertise in certain area do not use it because is stilling your trade and your knowledge, do not train the very thing that will get you unemployed.
